alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 6:39AM CST until January 28 at 9:15PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Morales affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Navidad River at Morales. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water reaches the right approach to the bridge at County Road 283. Livestock should be removed from vulnerable areas of the flood plain. At 30.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding occurs as water inundates County Road 283. Livestock could be cut off and should be removed from the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM CST Sunday the stage was 29.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM CST Sunday was 31.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 7.1 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.8 feet on 05/02/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Navidad River Morales 29.0 30.0 Sun 6 am CST 12.8 8.1 7.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM CST.
